meanings.sent1: She was miling brightly at her friend.
meanings.sent2: The children were miling happily during recess.
meanings.sent3: The puppy kept miling at its reflection in the mirror.
meanings.sent4: The flowers in the garden seemed to be miling at the sun.
meanings.sent5: His face lit up, miling with pure joy.

meanings.definition: A unit of length equal to one thousandth of an inch.
meanings.sent1: The fabric was so thin, it measured only a few milings.
meanings.sent2: He needed a precise measurement, down to the miling.
meanings.sent3: The tailor used a special ruler to measure the tiny milings.
meanings.sent4: The jeweler worked meticulously, measuring each miling of the gem.
meanings.sent5: The carpenter carefully cut the wood to the exact miling.

meanings.definition: A unit of angular measurement equal to one sixtieth of a degree.
meanings.sent1: The engineer adjusted the angle by a few milings.
meanings.sent2: The telescope was calibrated to measure milings accurately.
meanings.sent3: The sailor navigated using the milings on the compass.
meanings.sent4: The architect designed the building with precise milings in mind.
meanings.sent5: The mathematician calculated the angle to the nearest miling.
